timeline.message: DB-8883 Referencing clause for statement triggers

timeline.bodyText: I think a while() loop would be a bit clearer, but it's nitpicking.
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText:
@OlegMazurov Do you think there's a chance of simplifying this now that we support nested context managers? Here's Mark's comment from the previous PR:
Yes it is messy. The ContextManager doesn't seem well designed for threading. The ExecutionStmtValidator is required to detect if we're doing DDL on a trigger table. The TriggerExecutionContext is required to be in both the LCC of the Activation and of the active ContextManager for proper trigger execution. A lot of the time the Activation and the ContextManager share the same LCC, which is what we want. But sometimes the ContextManager's LCC is pushed in someplace unexpected and we end up with a mismatch. I think the whole ContextManager logic should probably be revisited and maybe rewritten. I had tried some things to add more synchronization or use different data structures, e.g. ConcurrentHashMap in place of HashMap, but that either caused the database to run too slowly or caused hangs or other failures.
timeline.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText: I have filed DB-9282: Rework DB-8883 to rely on nested ContextManager's to deal with this separately.
